intro: Passiflora uribei, commonly known as the Uribé passionflower, is a species native to Colombia. It is a climbing vine characterized by its striking, complex flowers that feature a blend of red, blue, and white petals. The plant produces edible, orange-colored berries that are rich in nutrients. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in humid, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for both horticulturists and botanists.
